    • Constructor Detail

      • SKConnection

        public SKConnection(int type,
                    java.net.Socket socket)
        Constructs a new connection over the specified socket. The socket side of this connection must be specified with a type (SK_SERVER or SK_CLIENT).
        Parameters:
        type - - the type of this connection. One of SK_SERVER or SK_CLIENT
        socket - - the socket of this connection

    • Method Detail

      • init

        protected SKConnection init(SKPacket packet)
        Sends the session initialization packets between client and server. The procedure depends on what type this connection.

        This method should only be called internally from the SKNet API.

        Parameters:
        packet - - the packet to send to the other end of this connection. Either SKClientPacket or SKServerPacket
        Returns:
        this connection instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument was not of type SKClientPacket or SKServerPacket. Also thrown if the argument does not correspond to this connection type.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing stream header
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the end-point responded an invalid session initialization packet or if a client failed to validate a packet.

      • close

        protected void close()
        Closes the socket and I/O streams of this connection.

      • startListening

        protected void startListening()
        Starts the communication listener thread for this connection.

      • sendPacket

        public SKConnection sendPacket(SKPacket packet)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a packet to the end-point of this connection's socket.
        Parameters:
        packet - - the packet to be sent
        Returns:
        this connection instance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the output stream failed to operate.

      • receivePacket

        protected SKPacket receivePacket()
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Waits for a packet to be received.
        Returns:
        the received packet
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the object received was not of instance SKPacket
        java.io.IOException - if the InputStream failed to operate.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the received packet could not be identified as an existing class

      • setServer

        protected SKConnection setServer(SKServer server)
        Sets the server associated with with this connection. This will only work if the connection is of type SK_SERVER. Otherwise, an IllegalStateException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        server - - the server instance
        Returns:
        this connection instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this connection is not of type SK_SERVER

      • getServer

        protected SKServer getServer()
        Returns the server associated with with this connection. This will only work if the connection is of type SK_SERVER. Otherwise, an IllegalStateException will be thrown.
        Returns:
        the server instance of this connection
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this connection is not of type SK_SERVER

      • setClient

        protected SKConnection setClient(SKClient client)
        Sets the client associated with with this connection. This will only work if the connection is of type SK_CLIENT. Otherwise, an IllegalStateException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        client - - the client instance
        Returns:
        this connection instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this connection is not of type SK_CLIENT

      • getClient

        protected SKClient getClient()
        Returns the client associated with with this connection. This will only work if the connection is of type SK_CLIENT. Otherwise, an IllegalStateException will be thrown.
        Returns:
        the client instance of this connection
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this connection is not of type SK_CLIENT

      • getType

        public int getType()
        Returns the type of this connection. One of SK_CLIENT or SK_SERVER.
        Returns:
        the type of this connection

      • getHostAddress

        public java.lang.String getHostAddress()
        Returns the host address of this connection represented as a string.
        Returns:
        the host address of this connection

      • getID

        public int getID()
        Returns the id of this connection. If the id has not yet been assigned, or if the session initialization process failed, it will return -1.
        Returns:
        the id of this connection instance

      • isSocketClosed

        public boolean isSocketClosed()
        Returns whether or not this connections socket has been closed.
        Returns:
        whether or not this connections socket has been closed

      • isIOClosed

        public boolean isIOClosed()
        Returns whether or not the connection streams have been closed.
        Returns:
        whether or not the connection streams have been closed

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns the active port of this connection.
        Returns:
        the active port of this connection
